DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Complication Surgical Procedure Complication Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to disease or disorder that occurs from surgical procedure._the type of complications from the surgical procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to disease or disorder that occurs from surgical procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

Concepts.definition: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of complications from the surgical procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: WOUND INFECTION

Concepts.definition: Invasion of the site of trauma by pathogenic microorganisms.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Splitting of the sutured margins of a surgical wound. Risk factors include diabetes mellitus, obesity, and advanced age.

Concepts.definition: Splitting of the sutured margins of a surgical wound. Risk factors include diabetes mellitus, obesity, and advanced age.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Within the abdomen.::1: Accumulation of purulent material in tissues, organs, or circumscribed spaces, usually associated with signs of infection.

Concepts.definition: Within the abdomen.

An inflammatory process characterized by the accumulation of pus within a newly formed tissue cavity which is the result of a bacterial, fungal, or parasitic infection or the presence of a foreign body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: BOWEL OBSTRUCTION/ILEUS
The absence of life or state of being dead.

Concepts.definition: The cessation of life.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: CARDIOPULMONARY COMPLICATION
Any disorder of the organs of the urinary system occurring as a consequence of injury to the urinary system.

Concepts.definition: Any disorder of the organs of the urinary system occurring as a consequence of injury to the urinary system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: ANASTOMOTIC LEAK

Concepts.definition: No value exists.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Associated concept to VM for TCGA. mc 11/9/12 - reversed concept order to match the semantics of this phrase which is "other" with "specify" as a qualifier/modifier - DW 12-30-2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An acute, acute and chronic, or chronic inflammation focally or diffusely affecting the lung parenchyma, due to infections (viruses, fungi, mycoplasma, or bacteria), treatment (e.g. radiation), or exposure (inhalation) to chemicals. Symptoms include cough, shortness of breath, fevers, chills, chest pain, headache, sweating, and weakness.

Concepts.definition: An acute, acute and chronic, or chronic inflammation focally or diffusely affecting the lung parenchyma, due to infections (viruses, fungi, mycoplasma, or bacteria), treatment (e.g. radiation), or exposure (inhalation) to chemicals. Symptoms include cough, shortness of breath, fevers, chills, chest pain, headache, sweating, and weakness.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: 11.19.2020 Updated concept annotation and long name to current NCIt . mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.

Concepts.definition: The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: heart/lung bypass

Acute or chronic condition, characterized by the inability of the kidneys to adequately filter the blood substances, resulting in uremia and electrolyte imbalances. Acute renal failure is usually associated with oliguria or anuria, hyperkalemia, and pulmonary edema. Chronic renal failure is irreversible and requires hemodialysis.

Concepts.definition: An acute or chronic condition that is characterized by the inability of the kidneys to adequately filter the blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Death prior to hospital discharge
Sudden and sustained deterioration of the kidney function characterized by decreased glomerular filtration rate, increased serum creatinine or oliguria.

Concepts.definition: Sudden and sustained deterioration of the kidney function characterized by decreased glomerular filtration rate, increased serum creatinine or oliguria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Conditions in which the KIDNEYS perform below the normal level in the ability to remove wastes, concentrate URINE, and maintain ELECTROLYTE BALANCE; BLOOD PRESSURE; and CALCIUM metabolism. Renal insufficiency can be classified by the degree of kidney damage (as measured by the level of PROTEINURIA) and reduction in GLOMERULAR FILTRATION RATE. The most severe form is KIDNEY FAILURE. Renal function may deteriorate slowly (RENAL INSUFFICIENCY, CHRONIC) or precipitously (RENAL INSUFFICIENCY, ACUTE).: (dye-AL-ih-sis) The process of cleansing the blood when the kidneys are not able to filter the blood.

Concepts.definition: Conditions in which the KIDNEYS perform below the normal level in the ability to remove wastes, concentrate URINE, and maintain ELECTROLYTE BALANCE; BLOOD PRESSURE; and CALCIUM metabolism. Renal insufficiency can be classified by the degree of kidney damage (as measured by the level of PROTEINURIA) and reduction in GLOMERULAR FILTRATION RATE. The most severe form is KIDNEY FAILURE. Renal function may deteriorate slowly (RENAL INSUFFICIENCY, CHRONIC) or precipitously (RENAL INSUFFICIENCY, ACUTE).
A procedure to remove toxic substances from the blood that is used in patients with end-stage chronic kidney disease or acute kidney failure. This includes hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The unwanted discharge of a fluid from some container or vessel.::1: The long, tube-shaped organ in the abdomen that completes the process of digestion. The intestine has two parts, the small intestine and the large intestine.::2: A procedure to connect healthy sections of tubular structures in the body after the diseased portion has been surgically removed.

Concepts.definition: The unintentional discharge of a substance from a container or enclosed space.
The portion of the gastrointestinal tract between the stomach and the anus. It includes the small intestine and large intestine.
A natural or surgically-induced connection between tubular structures in the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by the presence of pathogenic microorganisms in the blood stream that cause a rapidly progressing systemic reaction that may lead to shock.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of pathogenic microorganisms in the blood stream that cause a rapidly progressing systemic reaction that may lead to shock.

PermissibleValues.value: Failure to wean from ventilator within 48 hours
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Failure to wean from ventilator within 48 hours

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Failure to wean from ventilator within 48 hours
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Failure to wean from ventilator within 48 hours
A blood clot (thrombus) in a deep vein in the thigh or leg.

Concepts.definition: A blood clot in a deep vein, predominantly in the lower extremity, but may include the pelvis or upper extremity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The closure of the pulmonary artery or one of its branches by an embolus, sometimes associated with infarction of the lung.

Concepts.definition: The obstruction of the pulmonary artery or one of its branches by an embolus, sometimes associated with infarction of the lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intubation; the insertion of a cannula or tube into a hollow body organ.

Concepts.definition: The insertion of a cannula or tube into a hollow body organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.: Disruption; an event that results in a displacement or discontinuity.

Concepts.definition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
An interruption or interference in continuity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Extending relatively far inward.: Infection occurring in the wound.

Concepts.definition: Extending relatively far inward.
Infection of a break in the skin or other tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of little substance or significance; involving only a surface.: Infection occurring in the wound.

Concepts.definition: Of little substance or significance; involving only a surface.
Infection of a break in the skin or other tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Death within 30 days of cystectomy
Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.: After surgery.

Concepts.definition: The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.
Relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An obstruction of the intestines, especially the ileum.: Any impairment, arrest, or reversal of the normal flow of intestinal contents toward the anus.

Concepts.definition: Decrease in peristalsis in the absence of a mechanical bowel obstruction.
Blockage of the normal flow of the intestinal contents within the bowel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by gross necrosis of the myocardium; this is due to an interruption of blood supply to the area.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by gross necrosis of the myocardium; this is due to an interruption of blood supply to the area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cardiac event with CPR

A sudden, nonconvulsive loss of neurologic function due to an ischemic or hemorrhagic intracranial vascular event. In general, cerebrovascular accidents are classified by anatomic location in the brain, vascular distribution, etiology, age of the affected individual, and hemorrhagic vs. nonhemorrhagic nature. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, pp777-810): A disorder characterized by a sudden loss of sensory function due to an intracranial vascular event.

Concepts.definition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.
A disorder characterized by a sudden loss of sensory function due to an intracranial vascular event.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bacterial infectious process affecting any part of the urinary tract, most commonly the bladder and the urethra. Symptoms include urinary urgency and frequency, burning sensation during urination, lower abdominal discomfort, and cloudy urine.

Concepts.definition: A bacterial infectious process affecting any part of the urinary tract, most commonly the bladder and the urethra. Symptoms include urinary urgency and frequency, burning sensation during urination, lower abdominal discomfort, and cloudy urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any impairment, arrest, or reversal of the normal flow of intestinal contents toward the anus.

Concepts.definition: Blockage of the normal flow of the intestinal contents within the bowel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by failure of the ileum to transport intestinal contents.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by failure of the ileum to transport intestinal contents.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lymph leakage/lymphocele requiring intervention
Symptomatic lymph leakage/lymphocele

Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.: Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.

Concepts.definition: Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.

PermissibleValues.value: Extensive intraoperative hemorrhage (> 40% of total blood volume)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extensive Intraoperative Hemorrhage (> 40% of total blood volume)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extensive Intraoperative Hemorrhage (> 40% of total blood volume)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Large in quantity, range, or spatial extent.: Occurring during the course of a surgical procedure.: Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.

Concepts.definition: Large in quantity, range, or spatial extent.
Occurring during the course of a surgical procedure.
The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In medicine, having to do with the movement of body parts.: Part of the peripheral nervous system composed of bundles of nerve fibers running to various organs and tissues of the body using chemical and electrical signals to transmit sensory and motor information from one body part to another.: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

Concepts.definition: In medicine, having to do with the movement of body parts.

Part of the peripheral nervous system composed of bundles of nerve fibers running to various organs and tissues of the body using chemical and electrical signals to transmit sensory and motor information from one body part to another.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Diarrhea requiring pharmacologic treatment lasting greater than 60 days after surgery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Diarrhea requiring pharmacologic treatment lasting greater than 60 days after surgery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Diarrhea requiring pharmacologic treatment lasting greater than 60 days after surgery

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Sensory nerve injury with functional outcome(other than Horner syndrome)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Sensory nerve injury with functional outcome(other than Horner syndrome)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unplanned removal of an organ other than the adrenal

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Chyle leak in the thorax or abdomen requiring drainage procedure or reoperation

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Chyle leak in the thorax or abdomen requiring drainage procedure or reoperation
Ileus longer than 10 days
Death within 30 days of surgery

PermissibleValues.value: Unplanned return to the operating theater
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Unplanned return to the operating theater

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Unplanned return to the operating theater
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unplanned return to the operating theater
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis.: Improper body tissue repair due to factors affecting one or more of the phases of wound healing, including hemostasis, inflammation, proliferation, and remodeling.

Concepts.definition: A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis.
Improper body tissue repair due to factors affecting one or more of the phases of wound healing, including hemostasis, inflammation, proliferation, and remodeling.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents and their multiplication, as well as the reaction by the host to these organisms and/or toxins that the organisms produce.

Concepts.definition: The invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents and their multiplication, as well as the reaction by the host to these organisms and/or toxins that the organisms produce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Abnormal communication most commonly seen between two internal organs, or between an internal organ and the surface of the body.: Escape (release, discharge) of fluid through an unintended location that is often accompanied by a loss of pressure and/or output.

Concepts.definition: Abnormal epithelial-lined communication between two anatomical structures.

Escape (Release, Discharge) of fluid (including blood or bodily fluid) through an unintended location; often accompanied by a loss of pressure and/or output. This includes both external and internal fluid leak. This does not include fluidized powder leak.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.: A localized collection of blood, usually clotted, in an organ, space, or tissue, due to a break in the wall of a blood vessel.

Concepts.definition: The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.
A localized collection of blood, usually clotted, in an organ, space, or tissue, due to a break in the wall of a blood vessel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

Concepts.definition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by an adverse local or general response from exposure to an allergen.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by an adverse local or general response from exposure to an allergen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of the pancreas.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the pancreas.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Postoperative Delayed Gastric Emptying Nausea and Vomiting Ileus

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Postoperative Delayed Gastric Emptying Nausea and Vomiting Ileus
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Delayed stomach emptying as a result of surgery.: Expelling the contents of the stomach and the sensations associated with it. They are symptoms of an underlying disease or condition and not a specific illness.: Decrease in peristalsis in the absence of a mechanical bowel obstruction.

Concepts.definition: Delayed stomach emptying as a result of surgery.
Expelling the contents of the stomach and the sensations associated with it. They are symptoms of an underlying disease or condition and not a specific illness.
Decrease in peristalsis in the absence of a mechanical bowel obstruction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A liver that is not adequately performing its function.

Conditions in which the KIDNEYS perform below the normal level in the ability to remove wastes, concentrate URINE, and maintain ELECTROLYTE BALANCE; BLOOD PRESSURE; and CALCIUM metabolism. Renal insufficiency can be classified by the degree of kidney damage (as measured by the level of PROTEINURIA) and reduction in GLOMERULAR FILTRATION RATE. The most severe form is KIDNEY FAILURE. Renal function may deteriorate slowly (RENAL INSUFFICIENCY, CHRONIC) or precipitously (RENAL INSUFFICIENCY, ACUTE).

Concepts.definition: Conditions in which the KIDNEYS perform below the normal level in the ability to remove wastes, concentrate URINE, and maintain ELECTROLYTE BALANCE; BLOOD PRESSURE; and CALCIUM metabolism. Renal insufficiency can be classified by the degree of kidney damage (as measured by the level of PROTEINURIA) and reduction in GLOMERULAR FILTRATION RATE. The most severe form is KIDNEY FAILURE. Renal function may deteriorate slowly (RENAL INSUFFICIENCY, CHRONIC) or precipitously (RENAL INSUFFICIENCY, ACUTE).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
